titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter Libbey papers 1978.100
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:16 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection includes letters, notes, a ticket for lifetime admission to the New York Gallery of Arts, and a memorial poem honoring Libbey. Materials date from 1847 to 1852.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in Albany, artist Walter Libbey (1829-1852) came to Brooklyn circa 1830. His death at a young age was due to tuberculosis.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes letters, notes, a ticket for lifetime admission to the New York Gallery of Arts, and a memorial poem honoring Libbey. Materials date from 1847 to 1852. Born in Albany, artist Walter Libbey (1829-1852) came to Brooklyn circa 1830. His death at a young age was due to tuberculosis.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bessie C. Matthews, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Walter Libbey papers, 1978.100, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
